docs.summary:
The wix-stores module contains functionality for working with your
 site's store from client-side code.
description: To use the Stores API, import `wixStores` from the `wix-stores` module:
```javascript
import wixStores from 'wix-stores';
> **Note:**
Additional Stores related APIs can be found in the [`CartIcon`]($w.CartIcon.html),
[`ProductPage`]($w.ProductPage.html), [`ThankYouPage`]($w.thankyoupage.html), and [`Currencies`](wix-pay-backend.Currencies.html) pages.

docs.summary: The wix-stores.cart module provides functionality for working with your site's cart from client-side code.
The wix-stores.navigate module provides functionality for navigating your store from client-side code.
The wix-stores.product module provides functionality for working with your store's products from client-side code.

**Deprecated.**
This function will continue to work, but a newer version is available at
[wix-stores.cart.getCurrentCart()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-stores/cart/getcurrentcart).
description: Gets the current site visitor's cart.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this function is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-stores.cart.getCurrentCart()`](wix-stores/cart/getcurrentcart).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { cart } from 'wix-stores'
> 2. If you plan to migrate all functions that use `wix-stores`,
>    remove the original `import wixStores` statement.
> 3. Look for any code that uses `wixStores.getCurrentCart()`,
>    and replace it with `cart.getCurrentCart()`.
>    Update your code to work with the new `cart.getCurrentCart()`
>    call and response properties.
> 4. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.

examples.title: Get the current site visitor's cart
body: *     "address":"235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"
*   "buyerNote": "This is a note from the buyer.",
*        "address":"235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"

params.name: productId
params.doc: The ID of the product whose availability is being checked.

params.name: choices
params.doc: Option choices to use when checking the product's availability in the form of an object containing a key:value pair for each product choice. For example, if a product has a size choice, this key value will be something like "Size" and its value will be something like "Large".

ret.doc: Fulfilled - The availability information of the product.

docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This function will continue to work, but a newer version is available at
[wix-stores.product.getOptionsAvailability()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-stores/product/getoptionsavailability).
description: Gets the availability of a product based on the specified option choices.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this function is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-stores.product.getOptionsAvailability()`](wix-stores/product/getoptionsavailability).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { product } from 'wix-stores'
> 2. If you plan to migrate all functions that use `wix-stores`,
>    remove the original `import wixStores` statement.
> 3. Look for any code that uses `wixStores.getProductOptionsAvailability()`,
>    and replace it with `product.getOptionsAvailability()`.
>    Update your code to work with the new `product.getOptionsAvailability()`
>    call and response properties.
> 4. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.

extra.description:
This example gets a product's availability information by specifying an option choice.
 Since all the product's options have a corresponding choice, a variant is selected.

params.name: productId
params.doc: ID of the product whose variants are being retrieved. Pass only this field to retrieve all the specified product's variants.

params.name: options
params.doc: Variant options to return. If not specified, all the product's variants are returned.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - The variants with the specified choices.

docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This function will continue to work, but a newer version is available at
[wix-stores.product.getVariants()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-stores/product/getvariants).
description: Gets the availability of a product based on the specified option choices.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this function is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-stores.product.getVariants()`](wix-stores/product/getvariants).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { product } from 'wix-stores'
> 2. If you plan to migrate all functions that use `wix-stores`,
>    remove the original `import wixStores` statement.
> 3. Look for any code that uses `wixStores.getProductVariants()`,
>    and replace it with `product.getVariants()`.
>    Update your code to work with the new `product.getVariants()`
>    call and response properties.
> 4. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.

examples.title: Get product variants by specified choices
Get product variants by variant IDs

params.name: handler
params.doc: The name of the function or the function expression to run when a cart changes.

docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This function will continue to work, but a newer version is available at
[wix-stores.cart.onChange()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-stores/cart/onchange).
description: The `onCartChanged()` function is a client-side event handler invoked every time the cart changes.
It takes a callback function which receives the new `Cart` object as a parameter.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this function is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-stores.cart.onChange()`](wix-stores/cart/oncartchanged).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { cart } from 'wix-stores'
> 2. If you plan to migrate all functions that use `wix-stores`,
>    remove the original `import wixStores` statement.
> 3. Look for any code that uses `wixStores.onCartChanged()`,
>    and replace it with `cart.onChange()`.
>    Update your code to work with the new `cart.onChange()`
>    call and response properties.
> 4. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.

examples.title: An event when a cart is changed
body: *     "address":"235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"
*   "buyerNote": "This is a note from the buyer.",
*        "address":"235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"

params.name: cartLineItemId
params.doc: ID of the cart line item to remove.

docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This function will continue to work, but a newer version is available at
[wix-stores.cart.removeProduct()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-stores/cart/removeproduct).
description: The `removeProductFromCart()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the
updated cart after the product is removed.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this function is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-stores.cart.removeProduct()`](wix-stores/cart/removeproductfromcart).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { cart } from 'wix-stores'
> 2. If you plan to migrate all functions that use `wix-stores`,
>    remove the original `import wixStores` statement.
> 3. Look for any code that uses `wixStores.removeProductFromCart()`,
>    and replace it with `cart.removeProduct()`.
>    Update your code to work with the new `cart.removeProduct()`
>    call and response properties.
> 4. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.

docs.summary: Function that runs when a cart changes.
Function that runs when an item is added or removed from the cart.
Function that runs when a cart changes.
An object representing an address.
An object representing a coupon applied in a shopping cart.
An object representing a visitor who abandoned a shopping cart.

members.name: identityType
members.doc:
Buyer's identity.
 One of:

 + `"ADMIN"`: Buyer is the site owner.
 + `"MEMBER"`: Buyer is a logged-in site member.
 + `"VISITOR"`: Buyer is not logged in.
 + `"CONTACT"`: A contact has been created for the buyer.

docs.summary: An object representing a custom text field.
An object representing a line item in a shopping cart.

members.name: totalPrice
members.doc: Total price charged to the customer for all line items after any applicable discounts.

members.name: lineItemType
members.doc:
Type of the line item.
 One of:

 + `"DIGITAL"`: Digital item.
 + `"PHYSICAL"`: Physical item.
 + `"CUSTOM_AMOUNT_ITEM"`: Item with a custom price.
 + `"UNSPECIFIED"`: Type can't be classified due to an error.

docs.summary: Anobjectrepresentingaline item's primary media.

members.name: type
members.doc: Mediaitem type. Currently only `"IMAGE"` type supported.

members.name: src
members.doc: Media item source for media uploaded to Wix (wix:image, wix:video or external URL).

docs.summary: An object representing a shopping cart.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Unique identifier of the shopping cart.

members.name: appliedCoupon
members.doc: Coupon applied in the shopping cart.

members.name: weightUnit
members.doc: The order's units of weight. One of: `"KG"`, `"LB"`, or `"UNSPECIFIED_WEIGHT_UNIT"`.

docs.summary: An object representing shipping information.
An object representing a currency.
An object representing a media item.
description: The `src` property of a `MediaItem` can be an image or video from the [Media Manager](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-the-media-manager).
The image source format for Media Manager images is:
`wix:image://v1/<uri>/<filename>#originWidth=<width>&originHeight=<height>[&watermark=<watermark_manifest_string>]`
The video source format is:
`wix:video://v1/<video_uri>/<filename>#posterUri=<poster_uri>&posterWidth=<width>&posterHeight=<height>`

members.name: type
members.doc: Media items type. Can be "image" or "video."

docs.summary: Anobjectrepresentingalineitemoption.
An object representing an order's totals.

members.name: subtotal
members.doc: The subtotal of all the order's line items, excluding tax.

members.name: shipping
members.doc: The total shipping price, including tax.

members.name: weight
members.doc: The total weight of the order's items.

members.name: quantity
members.doc: The total quantity of the the order's line items.

docs.summary: An object representing paging options.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Maximum number of variants to retrieve. Defaults to 300.

members.name: skip
members.doc: Number of variants to skip before the retrieved variants. Defaults to 0.

docs.summary: Anobjectrepresentinga product variant'soptionchoices.

members.name: optionKey
members.doc:
Value of the choice. This key name is
 dependent on the product option. For example, if a product
 has a size option, this key value will be something like "Size" and its value
 will be something like "Large".

 `optionKey` is not case-sensitive. Therefore the values for the option keys "`Size`", "`SIZE`", and "`size`" are combined.

docs.summary: Anobjectrepresentinganoptionforastoreproduct.
Anobjectrepresentingalltheavailableoptionsforastoreproduct, such as "Size" or "Color".
description: An option cannot be changed if it has choices and variants. To change an option, reset its variants with [`resetVariantData()`](wix-stores-backend.html#resetVariantData). For each option, you can define a maximum of six choices.

members.name: optionKey
members.doc:
Nameoftheoption.Thiskeyname
isdependentontheoptionsaddedtotheproduct.Forexample,ifaproducthasasize
 option,thiskeywillbesomethinglike`"Size"`.

 `optionKey` is not case-sensitive. Therefore the values for the option keys "`Size`", "`SIZE`", and "`size`" are combined.

docs.summary: An object returned by the `getProductOptionsAvailability()` function representing the availability of a product.

members.name: availableForPurchase
members.doc: Whether the product with the specified option choices is available for purchase.

members.name: productOptions
members.doc: An object representing all the available options for a store product.

members.name: mainMedia
members.doc: Main product media item (image or video) URL.

members.name: selectedVariant
members.doc: The variant of the product selected using the specified option choices if there is one.

docs.summary: An object representing the product variant selected using the `getProductOptionsAvailability()` function.

members.name: sku
members.doc: Product variant stock keeping unit value.

members.name: price
members.doc: Product variant price. The variant price must be greater than its discount.

members.name: formattedPrice
members.doc: Product variant price formatted with the currency.

members.name: formattedDiscountedPrice
members.doc: Discounted product variant price formatted with the currency.

members.name: visible
members.doc: Whether the product variant is shown in the store.

members.name: inStock
members.doc: Whether the product variant is in stock.

docs.summary: Anobjectrepresentinganoptionschoiceforastoreproduct, such as choice "Small" for the option "Size."
description: You can define between one and thirty choices for each option.

docs.summary: Anobjectrepresentingthechoicemedia.

An object representing the selection of specific variants of a product. Use only one of
 `choices` or `variantIds`.

members.name: variantIds
members.doc: IDs of the variants to retrieve.

members.name: quantity
members.doc: Product quantity to be displayed in the Quick View. Defaults to 1.

docs.summary: An object containing variant information to use when creating or updating variants.

members.name: price
members.doc: Variant price. The variant price must be greater than its discount. If the variant price has been updated, changes to the product price do not affect the variant price.

members.name: formattedPrice
members.doc: Variant price formatted with the currency.

members.name: formattedDiscountedPrice
members.doc: Discounted variant price formatted with the currency.

members.name: visible
members.doc: Whether the variant is visible in the store.

docs.summary: An object representing a product variant item.

members.name: choices
members.doc: Choices of the retrieved variant in the form of an object containing a key:value pair for each variant choice. For example, if a variant has a size option, this key value will be something like "Size" and its value will be something like "Large".

docs.summary: An object representing product variants.

members.name: items
members.doc: List of variant items that match the specified choices or variant IDs.

members.name: length
members.doc: Number of items in the current results page.

members.name: totalCount
members.doc: Total number of variants with the specified choices.

docs.summary: An object representing a custom item to be added to the cart.
